questions.text: When did the cough first start?
Has it been getting better, worse, or staying the same?
Is it a dry cough, or are you bringing up mucus or phlegm?
If you are producing mucus, what color is it? Clear, white, yellow, green, or blood-tinged?
Does the cough feel harsh, barking, or wheezy?
Are you having any fever or chills?
Have you noticed a sore throat, runny nose, or nasal congestion?
Are you short of breath, or do you feel tightness in your chest?
Have you had any wheezing or a whistling sound when you breathe?
Do you have pain in your chest or throat when you cough?
Does the cough get worse at night, after lying down, or after eating?
Have you noticed that it worsens in cold air, with exercise, or around smoke or dust?
Have you been in contact with anyone who has had a cold, flu, or similar symptoms?
Have you traveled recently or been in crowded places?
Have you been around smoke, pollution, or chemicals that might irritate your lungs?
Do you smoke, or are you exposed to secondhand smoke?
Do you have any history of asthma, allergies, or breathing problems?
Have you tried anything to relieve the cough, like over-the-counter medications or home remedies?
Did these treatments help at all?
Do you have any pain when breathing deeply?
Have you noticed any unusual taste in your mouth, like something bitter or sour, especially after coughing?
How much is this cough interfering with your daily activities or sleep?
Would you say the cough is mild, moderate, or severe?
